snippet: A report from a group of retired military leaders, which has campaigned for improved childhood nutrition, shines a light on obesity in the military and its risks to readiness.
abstract: Group of retired military leaders fighting for improved childhood nutrition says increase in number of overweight and out-of-shape service members who are unable to run long distances or perform physical tasks like push-ups poses direct threat to ability of United States to defend itself; says 12 percent of active-duty service members are obese, up 61 percent since 2002.
lead_paragraph: A report from a group of retired military leaders, which has campaigned for improved childhood nutrition, shines a light on obesity in the military and its risks to readiness.

headline.main: Poor Fitness in Military Poses Peril, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Poor Fitness in Military Poses Peril, Report Says

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
